title: Why Johnson & Johnson Stock Can Weather Legal Awards Against It
text:
It isn’t likely that Johnson & Johnson will actually need to pay the $8 billion that a Pennsylvania jury lay at its feet in a personal injury case this past week. But the staggering number of zeros worried some investors, and the company lost $7.3 billion in market capitalization over the next two days.

Personal injury lawsuits are part of the game for big pharma companies, and Johnson & Johnson (ticker: JNJ) is the biggest. But the skirmishes are starting to look like a siege. The company lost a $572 million decision...
description: Investors may have overreacted to Johnson & Johnson’s recent spate of multbillion-dollar losses in personal injury cases. J&J is big and aggressive, and can weather the legal awards, which may be less than the estimates.
